meanings.sent1: She was feeling arsey after a long day at work.
meanings.sent2: He always gets arsey when things don't go his way.
meanings.sent3: Don't be so arsey, it's just a little mistake.
meanings.sent4: Her arsey attitude was like a storm cloud over the office.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's arsey glare silenced the noisy classroom.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a rude or disrespectful manner
meanings.sent1: His arsey comments offended everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: She gave an arsey reply to the customer's question.
meanings.sent3: Being arsey won't get you any friends.
meanings.sent4: The arsey behavior of the guest shocked the hosts.
meanings.sent5: The arsey tone in his voice made her cringe.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of respect or consideration for others
meanings.sent1: Their arsey behavior towards the elderly was unacceptable.
meanings.sent2: The arsey way he treated his colleagues led to conflicts.
meanings.sent3: His arsey attitude made him unpopular among his peers.
meanings.sent4: The arsey disregard for rules caused chaos in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The arsey disregard for others' feelings was evident in her actions.
